title: Riot needs to decide wtf Camille is.
body:
Is she a hit and run champ? A fighter? A jungler? Or an assassin?

Because right now she's filling all of these pretty damn well.

Don't wanna fight the bitch face to face because she's got true damage and %hp damage and an INESCAPABLE ULT.

Don't want to attempt to fight the bitch with a ranged champ because she will tether her ass to the nearest wall and kick you in the face, stun your ass hit you twice do her sweep while she runs away and wins the trade.

You have essentially made Riven 2.0 in the sense of "fun to play against". I don't like losing a trade because she hard cheesed me. I don't enjoy being 100% stuck inside of the dumbest ult you could possibly think of.

Imagine for a second, if you would, that when {{champion:57}}  ults and you're inside his ring that you're unable to escape. They would shit all over him in a heartbeat and people would be outraged.

Yes I got shit on by a Camille, yes I'm salty but this bitch is the definition of cancer. I would rather play {{champion:136}} vs {{champion:238}}  than to have Camille in my game again.

The only divers in here are Vi and Shyvana, all the rest are duelists or slayers...
Irelia is a diver as is Lee.

All that irelia has to dive is a single target dash, she has 1 single target hard CC and can only dish out single target damage appart from the mediocre damage from her ult. Most definitely a duelist.

Lee could be considered a diver, but his kit is much more duel oriented with single target execution damage, attack speed steroid and he can make picks by using his ult. More slayer oriented.

If you look at let's say shyvana, she uses her ult to get right in the middle of the enemy team and then she dishes out loads of AOE damage with her W, E and dragon form Q. She is meant to jump in the enemy team and can initiate a fight.

Same for Vi, jumps in the middle of the enemy team and initiate the fight while dealing some decent AOE damage with E and ult+ making possible for her team to follow up on her engage.

A duelist and a diver are close in a way where they can make picks on single targets, but the diver will have more teamfight oriented mechanics while the duelist is purely 1v1. 

The diver's kit is oriented towards being in the center of the enemy team and soaking up damage while making pics/engages (ex: Vi has a shield passive, Shyvana has a resistance passive and gains HP from ulting).

The duelist has a kit oriented towards picking a target, sticking to it and has advantages for sticking to one target (ex: Irelia's E can stun a target if she is lower than him, Xin's passive can reduce armor but only for one person, Camille and Fiora have some auto attack based buffs (aka single target damage)). The duelist is more oriented towards ignoring the enemy team (ex: Irelia's passive making it hard to peel her the more enemies are around her, Wukong gaining tankiness in a similiar manner) or denying them an access to their target (ex: Xin and Camille ult).

Good examples of divers would be {{champion:254}} {{champion:102}}  {{champion:120}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:62}} .

Divers

"Divers are the more mobile portion of the Fighter class. Divers excel at singling out high-priority targets to blitz toward, immediately forcing those targets (and their teammates) to deal with the diver’s presence. Divers are not as durable as the tanks or juggernauts of the world, but Divers can take their fair share of punishment while bringing enough damage to be a real kill threat if left unchecked."

Divers are actually more single target but they do force themselves into the enemy team to find this target and stay on them. Xin does this perfectly because his ult knocks away everyone but his target. 

Being in the center of the enemy team and soaking damage is more of a vanguard thing. 

Duelists are more like skirmishers now. 

"Unlike Assassins, Skirmishers aim to shred through any nearby enemy that approaches. Because Skirmishers lack high-end burst damage or reliable ways of closing in on high-priority targets, they are instead armed with situationally powerful defensive tools to survive in the fray, along with extreme sustained damage to cut down even the most durable targets"

The key difference is that skirmishers are more dps based while divers are more bursted based. And skirmishers usually have more freeform mobility while divers is more straightforward (Divers mainly use their mobility once in a fight to engage. Lee Sin's example is his Q, he doesn't really jump twice in a fight with his Q and his W only works on allied units).

You just recommended that she get utterly gutted. All of those being nerfed simultaneously would make her gutter trash.

Additionally, her ult is fine. I cannot express to you how many people I see who just run to the edge and sit there when she ults them, while their team watches. First of all, attack her. If you know you're dead, at least beat her up a bit. Secondly, your team should rush in on her when they can, it doesn't keep them out. Making her ult blinkable/dashable/flashable would defeat the whole purpose of her ult. It would basically mean that immobile champions are 100% screwed by her and that any champion made or reworked after 2014 will ignore her ult entirely. It's not a "broken" mechanic that it shuts down mobility - Cassiopeia's Miasma does the exact same thing for as long as you're in it, and it's a basic ability. Camille's ult does no damage on its own, unlike Jarvan's, so it needs something to distinguish itself. Play her some and understand how she operates before calling for across the board nerfs on her.
